quiz.title: Unit 2: 1D Kinematics (Quiz 7)
quiz.subtitle: Multi-Stage Motion and Free Fall Problems (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: A car starts from rest, accelerates constantly, and reaches 20 m/s in 5 seconds. It maintains the speed for 10 seconds, and goes to rest 5 seconds later, uniformly. What is its total displacement?
questions.explanation: Phase 1 (accel): $s_1 = \frac{0+20}{2} \times 5 = 50$ m. Phase 2 (constant): $s_2 = 20 \times 10 = 200$ m. Phase 3 (decel): $s_3 = \frac{20+0}{2} \times 5 = 50$ m. Total = $300$ m.

questions.question: A van starts from rest, accelerates constantly, and reaches 25 m/s in 5 seconds. It maintains the speed for 15 seconds, and goes to rest 10 seconds later, uniformly. What is its average speed?
The area under a velocity-time graph represents which physical quantity?
questions.explanation: Area under velocity-time graph gives displacement. For motion in one direction only, it also equals distance.

questions.question: A ball is thrown horizontally from a cliff. Simultaneously, another ball is dropped from the same height. Which hits the ground first?
options: They hit at the same time.
It depends on the horizontal speed.
questions.explanation: Vertical motion is independent of horizontal motion. Both start with zero vertical velocity and same height, so they hit simultaneously.

questions.question: What is the physical meaning of the slope of an acceleration-time graph?
questions.explanation: Slope of acceleration-time graph = rate of change of acceleration, which is called 'jerk'.

questions.question: If an object's position-time graph is a straight line, what can you definitively say about its acceleration-time graph?
options: It is a horizontal line above the x-axis.
It is a horizontal line along the x-axis.
It is a straight line with a non-zero slope.
It cannot be determined without knowing the initial velocity.
questions.explanation: Straight line position-time means constant velocity, so acceleration is zero. Acceleration-time graph is a horizontal line on the x-axis (at a=0).

questions.question: A small rock is thrown from a tower 60 m high. At what time would it touch the ground? (Take $g = 9.8\text{ m/s}^2$)
A pebble is thrown vertically upward at 20 m/s. What is the time it would take to touch the ground? (Take $g = 9.8\text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: Time to reach max height = $u/g = 20/9.8 = 2.04$ s. Total time = $2 \times 2.04 = 4.08$ s (if launched from ground level).

questions.question: A particle is released from a height and touches the ground in 15 seconds. The particle must have been dropped from what height? (Take $g = 9.8\text{ m/s}^2$)
A point mass was vertically dropped from 100 m high. If it touched the ground in 3 seconds, what was the initial velocity? (Take $g = 9.9\text{ m/s}^2$)
